column2: The Shadow Thieves are a versatile criminal guild that deal in ten different criminal activities. They are Assassins, Beggars, Bounty Hunters, Con Artists and Tricksters, Burglars, Cutpurses and Pickpockets, Enforcers and Thugs, Racketeers, Scouts and Spies, Fences, Smugglers and Pirates. They are a strongly structured organization, using this as an advantage to avoid any action that desegregates the whole organization.
The Grandmaster of Shadows is the supreme leader of the Shadow Thieves. They run the Shadow Council which determines the important decisions of the guild.
Those who have not yet proven themselves are simply a Shadow Thief, nothing more.
The Silhouettes are the local guild masters, given autonomous control over one of the ten criminal activies in which the Shadow Thieves deal.
One Cloakmaster administers an area of a maximum of 10,000 people. The hierarchy of the Shadow Thieves combined with the Cloakmaster's skill ensures the law will have a difficult time keeping up.

The Shadow Council divides the Realms territory in each region, with each Shadow Councilor acting as supreme leader of that territory. They lead the Cloakmasters and are only outranked by the Grandmaster of Shadows.

The Harpers are a semi-secret organization dedicated to promoting good, preserving history (including art and music of old) and maintaining a balance between civilization and nature by keeping kingdoms small and the destruction of plant life to a minimum. The original Harpers were founded by Myth Drannan Elves and took their name and symbol from their founder's family crest.
While the High Harpers have no one above them, there is always one High Harper who is given the respectful position of first among equals.
A new initiate to the Harpers. These individuals are dedicated to battling evil, discovering and preserving forgotten lore, and maintaining the balance between nature and civilization.

The Harper agents or "scouts" are scattered all across Faerûn. Harper agents are the "field agents" of the Harper organization, acting directly to gather intelligence and eliminate threats to the greater good.

Master Harpers are the elite agents of the Harpers. They study spells and develop many skills to help them in their duties of preserving lore by imparting it to others, raising morale and aiding other members of the Harpers as well as others who promote similar aims.
The High Harpers are a council of powerful individuals who plan the long-term goals of the Harpers.

The Eldreth Veluuthra or Victorious Blade of the People in Common, was formed in 262 DR to investigate the threat humans face to elves. They decided that humans were equivalent to vermin, and have since been dedicated to the stop of human expansion and the eventual removal of all human kind from Faerûn. They are recruited from the most wealthy elves who fund and lead the organization, as well as the most impoverished and disillusioned elves who act as expendable saboteurs.
The head of the Vel'Nikeryma is the most respected member. They are a devastating scourge to humankind.

The cell members of the Eldreth Veluuthra go about their daily lives, working or maintaining families, and take up duties when called for. Although there are a few adventuring companies, these generally do not last long due to the high casualties involved in such a cell style.
Cells decide their leadership from among their members. If a leader could not be removed by diplomatic means, approval from the Vel'Nikeryma was sought to take further measures.

Any capable member can request agent status, which must be approved by the Vel'Nikeryma. Agents take on duties anywhere in Faerûn. They gain access to passwords, handshakes and symbols that help identify them to the other agents scattered throughout Faerûn.

The Vel'Nikeryma (or Blade Lords) is the organization that acts as the guiding council for the Eldreth Veluuthra. Its' purpose is to gather information from across Faerûn in order to dictate the direction of the Eldreth Veluuthra but, in general, they avoided intervention in individual cells' matters.
Cults require §R3rd§! and §R4th§! rank to be either a §GDivine§! or §BArcane§! caster.

The Cult of the Dragon was founded by the wizard Sammaster (called "the Mad" or "First-Speaker" depending on viewpoint) who believed that undead dragons would one day rule over all of Toril. The cult recruits dragons into their cause with promises of power and immortality, eventually aiming to turn them into deadly dracoliches.
The head of the Cult of the Dragon is the heir to Sammaster "First-Speaker." To fulfill his grand vision requires magical mastery and immense ambition. Only a rare few are capable...

The lowest ranks of the Cult of the Dragon are mostly made up of soldiers-for-hire who are paid a small amount by the cult. They usually have very little to do with the day-to-day operation of the cult and are tested to see if they have the commitment required to officially join.

The cultists are the first rank able to plan, manage, and operate in a cell as a whole. They are primarily made up of adventurers of one sort of another. They often travel to generate financial resources or protect those who outrank them.

Although a cult, the Cult of the Dragon as a whole, does not worship any being capable of granting them any divine spells. Instead, priests and priestesses often serve an honorary role. Though many clerics choose to worship evil gods and cast their spells, it is not a requirement.

Arguably the most essential tier of the Cult of the Dragon are the wearers of purple, who can usually cast the spells required to gain draconic allies. Although all spellcasters are welcome to the rank, necromancers are particularly in high demand.

The Arcane Brotherhood is a wizard guild from Luskan, shrouded in mystery, whose primary goal is the political and economic control of the North of Faerun. The archwizards who rule the Brotherhood have their fingers in any number of unsavory pies, including piracy, slavery, drug trafficking and smuggling.
The head of the Arcane Brotherhood is known as the Archmage Arcane.
The §YFaerûnian Polytheism§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Faerûnian Polytheism faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Faerûnian Polytheism society
The Triad is an alliance of Tyr, Ilmater and Torm, supported by a few other less-powerful deities. Together, they strive to oppose injustice and evil in the Realms and beyond.
The §YTriadic§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Triadic faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Triadic society

The arcane magic of the Weave is a fact of life in the Realms, so it should come as no surprise that the deities who govern such matters are given high consideration, particularly in societies dominated by wizards and sorcerers.
The §YArcane§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Arcane faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Arcane society

The Rashemi faith focuses on the worship of a group of deities known as the Three, known broadly in Faerûn as Chauntea, Mystra (later replaced by Selûne), and Mielikki, as well as a number of nature spirits. Their religion is also dominated by women, and favours arcane spellcasters over others.
The §YRasallesian§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Rasallesian faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Rasallesian society

The people of Chessenta worship a mixture of western and eastern deities, putting special emphasis on their draconic hero-founder Tchazzar. Their pantheon has mostly a Neutral outlook and focuses both on philosophy and militarism.
The §YChessic§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Chessic faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Chessic society

Focusing on the worship of Waukeen and Helm, as well as a host of lesser gods, this religion is particularly prevalent in the Lands of Intrigue and tends to concern itself with more mundane matters than Good or Evil.
The §YMercantile§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Mercantile faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Mercantile society

The deities of knowledge and invention are headed by the god Oghma, who together with his allies seek to preserve and categorize the knowledge of the Realms. Their followers also share in this passion for learning and discovery, and highly value academic pursuits as a result.
The §YInventive§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Inventive faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Inventive society

Sune Firehair leads a small pantheon of deities related to joy, beauty, and love. These gods encourage the pursuit of happiness and free love, while also condemning war, aggression, and the domination of others.
The §YJoyful§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Joyful faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Joyful society

The practices of the southern people of Calimshan share many similarities with neighbouring faiths, but also include a great many unique features as well. Though nearly every deity is acknowledged, a handful are held as being more important and given special consideration. Notably, the faithful accept and venerate powers held as evil by most outsiders.
The §YCalishite Faith§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Calishite Faith faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Calishite Faith society

The people of the Lapal coast have similar practices to their Calishite relations, but with the notable difference of how each settlement has its own civic deity that is worshipped almost exclusively there. They also have a distinct distaste for reptilian gods due to their historic conflicts with the yuan-ti.
The §YLapal§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Lapal faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Lapal society

Chauntea is the Faerûnian goddess of life and bounty, who viewed herself as the embodiment of all things agrarian. The radical arm of the Church of Chauntea believes that as Chauntea personifies the whole earth, so her worship must be spread to all the ends of the world. Because of that, they are far more prone to proselytising than other patrons of Chauntea.
The §YChauntean Faith§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Chauntean Faith faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Chauntean Faith society

The Mulhorandi pantheon is headed by Horus-Re and encompasses a host of deities that were brought to Toril in distant times from a distant world, in response to the pleas of their followers who had been enslaved by the ancient Imaskari.
The §YMulhorandi Faith§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Mulhorandi Faith faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Mulhorandi Faith society

The Untheric pantheon was brought to Toril long ago from another realm, in an attempt to free their followers from enslavement by the Imaskari. Though headed by Gilgeam, many deific wars have extracted a toll on the pantheon and most of its members are dead.
The §YUntheric§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Untheric faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Untheric Faith society

The people of the Endless Wastes follow a small group of nature gods and practice ancestor worship, as well as some beast cults. They do not have any gods they consider to be evil, instead blaming it on malefic spirits.
The §YTuigan Shamanism§! pilgrims that flock to the holy site in §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! impress me with the depth and passion of their faith. I am tempted to convert in secrecy...
In secret, Tuigan Shamanism faithfuls have organized themselves as a community in this province. From there it converts others, grows, and protects their own.
column3: En secret, les fidèles se sont organisés en tant que communauté dans cette province. De là, la commaunauté convertit d'autres personnes, grandit et protège les siens.

column2: A High Priest in the Hidden Tuigan Shamanism society

The Emerald Enclave is an organization of druids and other nature worshipers on the island of Ilighôn. Its members avoid good and evil to focus on the needs of the natural world and resist the growing influence of humankind. Despite their primary goal of preserving nature, members are not direct opponents of progress, they prefer instead to work with civilized folk to promote the health of the natural world without resorting to acts of violence.

The three members of the Elder Circle (usually composed of the Masters of the Wild) were followers of Eldath, Mielikki, and Silvanus. Most members worshiped one of these deities and all wore some sort of green symbol. They traveled often, hunting for threats to the natural resources of the Reach and seeking potential allies in other lands.
